abstract: Online classified ads web site Kijiji, owned by eBay, is one of Canada's 10 most popular sites and is used by more than 12 million people per month, three times more than those using Craigslist, which dominated classified ads market in United States; site's success can be attributed to eBay official Janet Bannister; site is one of few brands that did not take off in US but found success elsewhere.
lead_paragraph: The eBay-owned website, whose name means “village” in Swahili, attracts three times as many users in Canada as Craigslist, which dominates in the United States.

headline.main: Kijiji, a Flop in the U.S., Rules Online Classifieds in Canada
headline.print_headline: The Craigslist of Canada, Run by eBay

snippet: The eBay-owned website, whose name means “village” in Swahili, attracts three times as many users in Canada as Craigslist, which dominates in the United States.
